While flagged for PvP, you can attack other PvP flagged players, but other flagged players can do the same to you. You receive a <font color="#ff9900">10% XP bonus</font> while flagged. \n\nWhen you leave the Sanctuary, you will have a <font color="#ff9900">30 second protection</font> timer.

While flagged for PvP, you can attack and be attacked by other PvP flagged players. <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">Successful kills can get you Azoth Salt and PvP XP.</font> You recieve a <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">10% XP bonus</font> while flagged. \n\nWhen you leave the Sanctuary, you will have a <font face="lyshineui/fonts/Nimbus_semibold.font" color="#DDDDDD">30 second protection</font> timer.

This role is not needed for this Lobby.

A tank's role in the party is to absorb damage and attract the attention of enemies away from their allies. Tanks should wear heavy armor and equip Carnellian gems to allow them to taunt foes. A tank usually has some form of crowd control (stun, root, flatten) to stop foes from getting to their allies.

A damage dealer's role is to deal as much damage as possible to as many enemies as possible. They are responsible for killing foes before they can overwhelm the party. Damage dealers should invest in skills and attributes that focus on high damage and area of effect (AOE) attacks.
Blunderbuss, Bow, Fire Staff, Greataxe, Hatchet, Ice Gauntlet, Musket, Rapier, Spear, Void Gauntlet

Healers are responsible for keeping the party alive utilizing healing and mitigation buffs such as fortify. Healers can also be responsible for removing harmful debuffs from their allies such as bleeding or poison. Healers should invest in the Focus stat to maximize their healing effectiveness.
